metadata.title: The 17-Residue Transmembrane Domain of ß-Galactoside a2,6-Sialyltransferase Is Sufficient for Golgi Retention

abstract.original_text: ß-Galactoside a2,6-sialyltransferase (ST) is a type II integral membrane protein of the Golgi apparatus involved in the sialylation of N-linked glycans . A series of experiments has shown that the 17-residue transmembrane domain of ST is sufficient to confer localization to the Golgi apparatus when transferred to the corresponding region of a cell surface type II in-

sentences.segment_text: ß-Galactoside a2,6-sialyltransferase ( ST ) is a type II integral membrane protein of the Golgi apparatus involved in the sialylation of N-linked glycans .

A series of experiments has shown that the 17-residue transmembrane domain of ST is sufficient to confer localization to the Golgi apparatus when transferred to the corresponding region of a cell surface type II in -
